ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.
M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported
e.g., Baseline, 6-Month Follow Up, Year 2; Morning, At Bedtime

ElementDescription: Most people with mental health problems want to have paid employment.
Notes: 0 = Strongly disagree; 1 = Disagree; 2 = Neither agree or disagree; 3 = Agree; 4 = Strongly agree; 88 = Don't know

ElementDescription: If a friend had a mental health problem, I know what advice to give them to get professional help.
Notes: 0 = Strongly disagree; 1 = Disagree; 2 = Neither agree or disagree; 3 = Agree; 4 = Strongly agree; 88 = Don't know

ElementDescription: Medication can be an effective treatment for people with mental health problems.
Notes: 0 = Strongly disagree; 1 = Disagree; 2 = Neither agree or disagree; 3 = Agree; 4 = Strongly agree; 88 = Don't know

ElementDescription: Psychotherapy (e.g., talking therapy or counseling) can be an effective treatment for people with mental health problems.
Notes: 0 = Strongly disagree; 1 = Disagree; 2 = Neither agree or disagree; 3 = Agree; 4 = Strongly agree; 88 = Don't know

ElementDescription: People with severe mental health problems can fully recover.
Notes: 0 = Strongly disagree; 1 = Disagree; 2 = Neither agree or disagree; 3 = Agree; 4 = Strongly agree; 88 = Don't know

ElementDescription: Most people with mental health problems go to a healthcare professional to get help.
Notes: 0 = Strongly disagree; 1 = Disagree; 2 = Neither agree or disagree; 3 = Agree; 4 = Strongly agree; 88 = Don't know

ElementDescription: Mental Health Knowledge Schedule (MAKS) Total Score
Notes: Sum of responses to maks1 through maks12; Items 6, 8, and 12 should be reverse coded; Don't know response category originally scored as 88 and recoded as neutral (2) in line with MAKS scoring recommendations
